tit.cmt: 後で違う漢字がでてくるため、漢字を併記しました。

sen.j: 石塔 頼房（いしどう よりふさ）は、石塔氏３代当主。
sen.e: Yorifusa ISHIDO was the third family head of the Ishido clan.

sen.j: 義房の次子。
sen.e: The second child of Yoshifusa.

sen.j: 兄範家死没後に嫡子か。
sen.e: He seems to be born after his brother Noriie died.
He seems to became the legitimate child after his brother Noriie died.
sen.cmt: 兄の「範家の死後に嫡子になった」とも解釈できます。

sen.j: 石堂頼房も見よ。
sen.e: See also Yorifusa Ishido (石堂頼房).

sen.j: 最初は殆ど父の義房と行動し、1335年に中務大輔。
sen.e: He first worked with his father Yoshifusa, and became Nakatsukasa no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Central Affairs) in 1335.

sen.j: 1349年まで播磨国這田荘の地頭職を得る。
sen.e: Until 1349, he obtained the job of Jito shiki (manager and lord of a private estate) of Houdanosho in Harima Province.

sen.j: 高師直の排斥の計画が露見し、足利直義が大和国へ逃れると、直義を南朝 (日本)に服従させた。
sen.e: Being found out the plan of ostracizing KO no Moronao, Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA escaped to Yamato Province, and Yorifusa compelled Tadayoshi to submission to Nancho (the Southern Dynasty of Japan).

sen.j: 1350年（正平 (日本)5年/観応元年）に詔を承り生駒山で挙兵した。
sen.e: Yorifusa received an Imperial edict in 1350 and raised an army at Mt. Ikoma.

sen.j: 足利尊氏が播磨国の書写山（現兵庫県姫路市）へ奔ると、後を追い、そして尊氏軍を撃破する。
sen.e: Following Takauji ASHIKAGA, who ran off to Mt. Shosha (currently in Himeji City, Hyogo Prefecture) in Harima Province, Yorifusa obliterate Takauji's army.

sen.j: 1351末には、駿河薩埵山の戦いに敗北。
sen.e: At the end of 1351, Yorifusa was defeated the battle of Mt. Satta in Suruga Province.

sen.j: その後、直義が死去し、尊氏方に降る。
sen.e: Then Tadayoshi died and Yorifusa surrendered to Takauji's side.

sen.j: 父の義房が新田義興と内通し、このことを尊氏に通告し義興と戦う。
sen.e: His father Yoshifusa held secret communication with Yoshioki NITTA, warned this to Takauji, and battled with Yoshioki.

sen.j: やがて、足利直冬方に属し、南朝方武将となって刑部卿に補任された。
sen.e: In due course of time, he took Tadafuyu ASHIKAGA's side to become a busho (military commander) of the Southern Dynasty and appointed to Gyobukyo (Minister of Justice).

sen.j: 1353年には足利義詮を、1354年には尊氏を近江国に追った。
sen.e: He relegated Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA and Takauji to Omi Province in 1353 and 1354, respectively.

sen.j: 1361年（正平16年/康安元年）12月楠木正儀・細川清氏らと共に2代将軍の義詮を再び近江に奔らせ、暫く京で検断を司った。
sen.e: After having Yoshiakira, the second Shogun, escape to Omi again with Masanori KUSUNOKI and Kiyouji HOSOKAWA, Yorifusa worked as a Kendan (policing and adjudication authority) for some time.

sen.j: 翌1362年（正平17年/康安2年）摂津国に転戦し、赤松光範を攻撃した。
sen.e: In the following year, 1362, he moved to Settsu Province to battle, and attacked Mitsunori AKAMATSU.

sen.j: その後、貞治3年（1364年）頃に京を奪還した義詮に降伏した。
sen.e: Then, he surrendered to Yoshiakira, who recaptured the capital around 1364.

sen.j: この後、出家し叔父である時衆の名僧・国阿に弟子入りし、滋賀県大津市にある霊仙正福寺中興の祖となった。
sen.e: After that, he entered the priesthood, was taken on as a disciple of Kokua, who was a distinguished priest of Jishu school and Yorifusa's uncle, and became a Chuko no So (restorer) of Ryosen Shofuku-ji Temple in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 頼房の子三河守石塔頼世は将軍足利義満の馬廻を務めた。
sen.e: His son, 頼世 ISHIDO, a Mikawa no kami (the lord of Mikawa Province), served as an umamawari (mounted guards) for Shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA.
